channel.title: How Long it takes ur comp to start
channel.description: How Long it takes ur comp to start. Mine takes 30 minutes straight to load up thats y i put it on sleep :D

item.title: How Long it takes ur comp to start
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Stupit, post:20, topic:414576”]Just tested this. Windows 7 Start screen(where you put your password in): 17.54. On my Ubuntu section of my HD(where you put your password in): 11.9. So, not too bad.[/quote]Yeah there’s this program named “e4rat” that will sorta defrag your Ubuntu partition and put all the boot programs closer together physically and your boot time drastically increases.

Read full topic

item.title: How Long it takes ur comp to start
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Gnome 3 is one of the reasons I tried it on my laptop. It did install fast but the installer was boring, not that it matters :P. However the newest Ubuntu (11.10) now has Gnome 3 installed so to use gnome-shell it’s actually just as simple as:

Very nice.

EDIT: I still prefer Unity though.

Read full topic
item.source: How Long it takes ur comp to start

item.title: How Long it takes ur comp to start
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

I really do enjoy Gnome 3 a lot, and it comes stock on the newest release Lovelock. It has a small install time compared to openSUSE or Debian. I never have any problems with the display like I have had with other distributions. I don’t really know what to say besides it’s personally appealing to me. It’s almost like asking someone why the prefer Pepsi over any other soda.

Read full topic
item.source: How Long it takes ur comp to start

item.title: How Long it takes ur comp to start
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Then why would you prefer one over the other? Or even use Fedora for that matter over other distros?

EDIT: I’ve noticed that installing and just managing installed applications using RPM is very sluggish and a lot of the program versions are old on Fedora. Not saying Ubuntu is 100% clear of old programs but it’s a lot better.
And there’s also things like the Ubuntu Software Centre which make it extremely easy for novices to browse through and install all of their programs.
RPMs aren’t terrible and I was half-kidding when I was calling them shit but I strongly prefer DEB.

EDIT EDIT: And I’m just used to people claiming RPMs are better than DEB so I kind of assumed that’s where your stance was.

Read full topic
item.source: How Long it takes ur comp to start

item.title: How Long it takes ur comp to start
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:14, topic:414576”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=516541.msg3749690#msg3749690 date=1315949097]

I didn’t say Fedora had shitty performance. Just a shitty boot time. I also called Fedora shitty because it uses a shitty package manager. Shitty shitty shitty.

I have strong faith that you wouldn’t be able to give a legitimate reason why.
[/quote]Okay give me a reason why RPM (yum) is better than deb.

Oh and by the way I do use Fedora on my laptop.[/quote]

Just as I predicted.

Also, why should I? Obviously I never said either was better than each other.

Read full topic

item.title: How Long it takes ur comp to start
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:10, topic:414576”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=516541.msg3749675#msg3749675 date=1315948721]

Fedora’s shit and so is its boot time.

The boot time is high compared to other Linux distributions but Fedora is in fact, not shit.
[/quote]Actually yes it is shit. It’s the longest boot time of a Linux distro I’ve seen in fact.

Windows 7 ultimate and yes it does matter i get like 10 errors when i log in is like please replace hard disk , windows has detected a problem and u might be thinking u got a virus well no cuz i just installed windows 7 ultimate 1 day ago[/quote]Yes viruses usually will auto-start so it could be a problem. Also try defragging.

I never knew that the overall performance of the operating system was entirely based on it’s boot time. Hmm.

Read full topic
